Timetracking part 2 of N author: - name: Vadym Yudenko affiliation: American University Kyiv affiliation-url: https://auk.edu.ua/en/ date: 2023-07-14 draft: true categories: - timetracking - self-surveillance --- ## Why would you want to track your daily life? - who will benefit and in what way from spending some time during the day tracking how they have spent their time - time management skill - good reflection practice - ## My story - Why have I started tracking my daily life - ## Introduction (why have I started tracking my time?) Sometime in Summer 2019 I was bored and wasted days doing a whole lot of nothing. Before I never knew one can get tired from doing nothing, but that summer I languished a lot. On one such morning, having woken up at 12am hopelessly fatigue I had enough. I hated myself, for I was doing a whole lot of nothing, and at around that time I realized I needed meaning in my life - feeling of accomplishment and being proud of myself; was reading motivational books like 7 Habits and thinking about what do I do with my life. This is the WHY, now about the HOW. Earlier, in winter 2019 I started low-key learning Japanese on Duolingo, Drops, you name it. Overtime I got exposure to some real-deal try-hard stuff: Anki-gang, AJATT/MIA/Migaku. Guys were hell bent of mastering the language, they would spend days with the language, cut their social ties with external world - I liked them. Their approach - spend as much time with the language seamed reasonable, after all this IS how you acquire language. Among some of the stuff the One of them shared a video of how he was tracking his Japanese learning journey.
